                                  /**                                                                                                                                                                            
                             +     * Read all bytes from the stream with an upper limit to prevent memory exhaustion.                                                                                            
                             +     */                                                                                                                                                                            
                             +    private static byte[] readAllBytesWithLimit(InputStream in, long limit) throws IOException {                                                                                   
                             +        ByteArrayOutputStream buffer = new ByteArrayOutputStream();                                                                                                                
                             +        byte[] chunk = new byte[8192];                                                                                                                                             
                             +        long total = 0;                                                                                                                                                            
                             +        int read;                                                                                                                                                                  
                             +        while ((read = in.read(chunk)) != -1) {                                                                                                                                    
                             +            total += read;                                                                                                                                                         
                             +            if (total > limit) {                                                                                                                                                   
                             +                throw new IOException("PFB exceeds maximum allowed length");                                                                                                       
                             +            }                                                                                                                                                                      
                             +            buffer.write(chunk, 0, read);                                                                                                                                          
                             +        }                                                                                                                                                                          
                             +        return buffer.toByteArray();                                                                                                                                               
                             +    }                                                                                                                                                                              
                             +                                                                                                                                                                                   
                             +    /**                                                                                                                                                                            
                                   * the lengths of the records (ASCII, BINARY, ASCII)                                                                                                                           
                                   */

                                     at org.apache.pdfbox.text.PDFTextStripper.processPages(PDFTextStripper.java:303)                                                                                            
                                     at org.apache.pdfbox.text.PDFTextStripper.writeText(PDFTextStripper.java:251)                                                                                               
                                     at org.apache.pdfbox.text.PDFTextStripper.getText(PDFTextStripper.java:218)                                                                                                 
                                     at com.example.PDFExtractTextFuzzer.fuzzerTestOneInput(PDFExtractTextFuzzer.java:41)                                                                                        
                                     at java.base/java.lang.invoke.LambdaForm$DMH/0x0000000800cbc000.invokeStaticInit(LambdaForm$DMH)                                                                            
                                     at java.base/java.lang.invoke.LambdaForm$MH/0x0000000800cbd000.invoke(LambdaForm$MH)                                                                                        
                                     at java.base/java.lang.invoke.LambdaForm$MH/0x0000000800cbc800.invoke_MT(LambdaForm$MH)                                                                                     
                             DEDUP_TOKEN: 4fc18e0e0662428e                                                                                                                                                       
                             == libFuzzer crashing input ==                                                                                                                                                      
                             ===Evaluation Report===                                                                                                                                                             
                             # Evaluation Report                                                                                                                                                                 
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             ## Summary                                                                                                                                                                          
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             During fuzz testing of the PDF text extraction component, the fuzzer encountered a Java heap space exhaustion. The crash was reported as a `FuzzerSecurityIssueLow`                 
                             due to an `OutOfMemoryError` triggered while parsing a PFB (Printer Font Binary) stream. The failure path leads from the PDF text stripper into the Apache FontBox                  
                             PFB parser, resulting in a Denial-of-Servicetype issue caused by uncontrolled memory usage.                                                                                        
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             ## Description                                                                                                                                                                      
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             - Issue without speculation                                                                                                                                                         
                               A Java process running the PDF text extraction fuzzer exhausted its heap space and terminated with an `OutOfMemoryError`. The error surfaced in the Apache                        
                             FontBox library during the parsing of a PFB font resource.                                                                                                                          
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             - Vulnerability type                                                                                                                                                                
                               This is a memory exhaustion (Denial of Service) issue. The fuzzer framework classified it as `FuzzerSecurityIssueLow`, indicating that it can be exploited to                     
                             crash the process but does not directly lead to code execution or data corruption.                                                                                                  
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             - Important observations and findings                                                                                                                                               
                               1. The stack trace shows the error originating in `org.apache.fontbox.pfb.PfbParser.parsePfb` at line 166, during PFB stream parsing.                                             
                               2. The flow continues through `Type1Font.createWithPFB` and `PDFontFactory.createFont`, into `PDResources.getFont`, and finally into the PDF text stripping logic                 
                             (`SetFontAndSize`, `PDFStreamEngine`, `PDFTextStripper`).                                                                                                                           
                               3. The fuzzer harness (`PDFExtractTextFuzzer.fuzzerTestOneInput`) simply calls `PDFTextStripper.getText` on arbitrary inputs; the crash occurs inside the font                    
                             parsing library rather than the harness itself.                                                                                                                                     
                               4. Reproduction requires a large or malformed PFB data segment within a PDF, leading to unbounded memory allocation attempts.                                                     
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             - Code areas for investigation                                                                                                                                                      
                                PFB parsing routines in `org.apache.fontbox.pfb.PfbParser`                                                                                                                      
                                Font initialization in `org.apache.fontbox.type1.Type1Font.createWithPFB`                                                                                                       
                                Font factory methods in `org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.font.PDFontFactory.createFont`                                                                                               
                                Resource handling in `org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.PDResources.getFont`                                                                                                            
                                The text-stripping pipeline (`SetFontAndSize`, `PDFStreamEngine`, `PDFTextStripper`) to understand how font data is retrieved and buffered                                      
                                Fuzzer harness entry point (`PDFExtractTextFuzzer.fuzzerTestOneInput`) to confirm input delivery but note that it is not the root cause of the heap exhaustion.                 
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             ## Initial Issue Log                                                                                                                                                                
                             Here is the initial issue log of the codebase:                                                                                                                                      
                             <issue>

                             ===Analysis Report===                                                                                                                                                               
                             # Analysis Report                                                                                                                                                                   
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             ## Relevant Code Snippets                                                                                                                                                           
                             <code_snippets>                                                                                                                                                                     
                             <code>                                                                                                                                                                              
                             fontbox/src/main/java/org/apache/fontbox/pfb/PfbParser.java:68-76                                                                                                                   
                             ```                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             68:    /**                                                                                                                                                                          
                             69:     * Heuristically chosen max length to buffer a Type1 font                                                                                                                    
                             70:     */                                                                                                                                                                          
                             71:    private static final long MAX_LENGTH = 100_000_000;                                                                                                                          
                             72:                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             73:    /**                                                                                                                                                                          
                             74:     * the parsed pfb-data.                                                                                                                                                      
                             75:     */

                             ```

                             124:    private void parsePfb(final byte[] pfb) throws IOException                                                                                                                  
                             125:    {                                                                                                                                                                           
                             126:        if (pfb.length < PFB_HEADER_LENGTH)                                                                                                                                     
                             127:        {                                                                                                                                                                       
                             128:            throw new IOException("PFB header missing");                                                                                                                        
                             129:        }                                                                                                                                                                       
                             130:        // read into segments and keep them                                                                                                                                     
                             ```                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             </code>                                                                                                                                                                             
                             </code_snippets>                                                                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             ## Fix Strategy                                                                                                                                                                     
                             <fix_strategy>                                                                                                                                                                      
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             1. Overview and Root Cause                                                                                                                                                          
                                The OutOfMemoryError arises because the PfbParser constructors use unbounded reading methods (`InputStream.readAllBytes()` and `Files.readAllBytes`) that                        
                             allocate a byte array equal to the entire input size before any limits are enforced. Although `MAX_LENGTH` exists for parse-time bounds checking inside                             
                             `parsePfb(...)`, it cannot help if the JVM already attempted to allocate a buffer larger than available heap.                                                                       
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             2. Preservation of Existing Logic                                                                                                                                                   
                                - We must continue to load the full PFB data into a byte array for parsing by `parsePfb(...)`.                                                                                   
                                - Legitimate PFB files under the heuristic cap (`MAX_LENGTH`) must still be accepted and parsed unchanged.                                                                       
                                - Any error path should surface as an `IOException`, matching existing parse-failure mechanisms, rather than an uncaught `OutOfMemoryError`.                                     
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             3. Strategy Steps                                                                                                                                                                   
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                                A. Introduce a bounded-read utility in `PfbParser`                                                                                                                               
                                    Create a private static helper method                                                                                                                                       
                                      ```java                                                                                                                                                                    
                                      private static byte[] readAllBytesWithLimit(InputStream in, long limit)                                                                                                    
                                          throws IOException { ... }                                                                                                                                             
                                      ```                                                                                                                                                                        
                                    Implementation details:                                                                                                                                                     
                                       Use a loop to read into a fixed-size byte buffer (e.g., 8KB chunks).                                                                                                     
                                       Accumulate total bytes read in a `long` counter.                                                                                                                         
                                       If total exceeds `limit`, throw `IOException("PFB exceeds maximum allowed length")`.                                                                                     
                                       Otherwise, copy the collected bytes into a single byte[] and return it.                                                                                                  
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                                B. Patch the `InputStream` constructor (lines 103107)                                                                                                                           
                                    Replace `in.readAllBytes()` with `readAllBytesWithLimit(in, MAX_LENGTH + PFB_HEADER_LENGTH)`.                                                                               
                                    This ensures that any input stream longer than the combined header allowance and data cap is rejected before memory blowup.                                                 
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                                C. Patch the filename-based constructor (lines 9396)                                                                                                                            
                                    Before calling `Files.readAllBytes(...)`, check the file size:                                                                                                              
                                     ```java                                                                                                                                                                     
                                     Path path = Paths.get(filename);                                                                                                                                            
                                     long size = Files.size(path);                                                                                                                                               
                                     if (size > MAX_LENGTH + PFB_HEADER_LENGTH) {                                                                                                                                
                                         throw new IOException("PFB file too large: " + size);                                                                                                                   
                                     }                                                                                                                                                                           
                                     byte[] pfb = Files.readAllBytes(path);                                                                                                                                      
                                     parsePfb(pfb);                                                                                                                                                              
                                     ```                                                                                                                                                                         
                                    This pre-check avoids loading gigantic files into memory in one shot.                                                                                                       
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                                D. Reinforce bounds in `parsePfb(byte[])` (around line 124)                                                                                                                      
                                    As a secondary safeguard, add at the top of `parsePfb(...)`:                                                                                                                
                                     ```java                                                                                                                                                                     
                                     if (pfb.length > MAX_LENGTH + PFB_HEADER_LENGTH) {                                                                                                                          
                                         throw new IOException("PFB input exceeds maximum length");                                                                                                              
                                     }                                                                                                                                                                           
                                     ```                                                                                                                                                                         
                                    This catches any unforeseen invocation paths that bypass the constructors (e.g., future factory methods).                                                                   
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             4. Justification                                                                                                                                                                    
                                - By limiting reads at the source, we prevent unbounded heap allocations that lead directly to `OutOfMemoryError`.                                                               
                                - Converting the error into a controlled `IOException` aligns with the existing error-handling model in FontBox.                                                                 
                                - The three-layer defense (stream read, file read, parse-time check) preserves codebase invariants and does not affect normal operation for valid fonts.                         
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             5. Potential Side Effects and Mitigations                                                                                                                                           
                                - Overhead of size checks and chunked reads: negligible compared to parsing logic.                                                                                               
                                - If a font legitimately equals exactly `MAX_LENGTH`, add a small tolerance (e.g., `<= MAX_LENGTH + PFB_HEADER_LENGTH`) so we do not reject valid edge cases.                    
                                - Document in the Javadoc for `PfbParser` that inputs over 100 MB are now rejected for security/stability reasons.                                                               
                                - Ensure backward compatibility by making the new helper method private and adding no new public APIs.                                                                           
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             6. No External or Harness Modifications                                                                                                                                             
                                - The fuzzer harness remains untouched; it continues to feed arbitrary bytes through `PDFTextStripper.getText(...)`.                                                             
                                - Tests and other code paths in Apache PDFBox are unaffected; only PFB parsing is hardened.                                                                                      
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             7. References to Similar Patterns                                                                                                                                                   
                                - In other parts of FontBox (e.g., TrueTypeTable loaders), similar read with limit helpers are used to prevent resource exhaustion. Follow those idioms for                    
                             consistency (buffer sizes, exception messages).                                                                                                                                     
                                - If an Apache Commons `BoundedInputStream` already exists on the classpath, consider reusing it under the same license. Otherwise, use the custom helper.                       
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             By following this strategy, any malicious or overly large PFB stream will be rejected early with a clear `IOException`, preventing heap exhaustion while preserving                 
                             legitimate parsing behavior.                                                                                                                                                        
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             </fix_strategy>                                                                                                                                                                     
                             ===Evaluation End===

                             == libFuzzer crashing input ==                                                                                                                                                      
                             ===Evaluation Report===                                                                                                                                                             
                             # Evaluation Report                                                                                                                                                                 
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             ## Summary                                                                                                                                                                          
                             The projects PDF font parser (PfbParser) crashes under fuzz testing with an OutOfMemoryError when loading large PFB files. To mitigate this, a patch was proposed                  
                             that limits the size of data read into memory by introducing a `readAllBytesWithLimit` helper and bounding checks in the constructors. After applying the patch,                    
                             the build fails with four compilation errors: the compiler cannot resolve `ByteArrayInputStream` and `EOFException` symbols in `PfbParser.java`.                                    
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             ## Description                                                                                                                                                                      
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             Initial Issue                                                                                                                                                                       
                             - During Jazzer fuzzing, a huge or malformed PFB input causes `java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space` in `PfbParser.parsePfb`.                                                
                             - The stack trace shows the parser loading font streams without size checks, leading to unbounded memory growth.                                                                    
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             Patch Attempt                                                                                                                                                                       
                             - Added a private method `readAllBytesWithLimit(InputStream in, long limit)` to read data in chunks up to a configurable maximum (`MAX_LENGTH +                                     
                             PFB_HEADER_LENGTH`).                                                                                                                                                                
                             - In the `String`-based and `InputStream`-based constructors, inserted checks on file size (`Files.size(path)`) and total bytes read to throw an `IOException` if                   
                             limits are exceeded.                                                                                                                                                                
                             - Before parsing, added a guard in `parsePfb(byte[] pfb)` to reject arrays longer than the maximum allowed length.                                                                  
                             - Imported new classes (`ByteArrayOutputStream`, `Path`, `Paths`) but inadvertently removed or failed to restore imports for `ByteArrayInputStream` and                             
                             `EOFException`.                                                                                                                                                                     
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             Patch Application Result                                                                                                                                                            
                             - Maven compilation errors in `fontbox/src/main/java/org/apache/fontbox/pfb/PfbParser.java`:                                                                                        
                               1) Line 161: cannot find symbol `ByteArrayInputStream`                                                                                                                            
                               2) Line 198: cannot find symbol `EOFException`                                                                                                                                    
                               3) Line 276: cannot find symbol `ByteArrayInputStream`                                                                                                                            
                             - The errors indicate unresolved references to `java.io.ByteArrayInputStream` and `java.io.EOFException` in multiple locations, preventing a successful build.                      
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             Areas for Further Investigation                                                                                                                                                     
                             - The import section of `PfbParser.java`: ensure all required I/O classes (`ByteArrayInputStream`, `EOFException`, and any others referenced) are present.                          
                             - The methods and code paths around the reported line numbers (approximately 161, 198, 276) where `ByteArrayInputStream` and `EOFException` are still used.                         
                             - Verify consistency between the parsing logic (use of in-memory streams) and the new size-limiting methods.                                                                        
                             - Check other related classes or methods in the `org.apache.fontbox.pfb` package that may rely on the same imports or parsing patterns.                                             
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             ## Initial Issue Log                                                                                                                                                                
                             Here is the initial issue log of the codebase:

                             # Analysis Report                                                                                                                                                                   
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             ## Relevant Code Snippets                                                                                                                                                           
                             <code_snippets>                                                                                                                                                                     
                             <code>                                                                                                                                                                              
                             fontbox/src/main/java/org/apache/fontbox/pfb/PfbParser.java:19-24                                                                                                                   
                             ```

                             ```

                             fontbox/src/main/java/org/apache/fontbox/pfb/PfbParser.java:130-140                                                                                                                 
                             ```                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             130:        // read into segments and keep them                                                                                                                                     
                             131:        List<Integer> typeList = new ArrayList<>(3);                                                                                                                            
                             132:        List<byte[]> barrList = new ArrayList<>(3);                                                                                                                             
                             133:        ByteArrayInputStream in = new ByteArrayInputStream(pfb);                                                                                                                
                             134:        int total = 0;                                                                                                                                                          
                             135:        do                                                                                                                                                                      
                             136:        {                                                                                                                                                                       
                             137:            int r = in.read();                                                                                                                                                  
                             138:            if (r == -1 && total > 0)                                                                                                                                           
                             139:            {                                                                                                                                                                   
                             140:                break; // EOF                                                                                                                                                   
                             ```                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             </code>                                                                                                                                                                             
                             <code>                                                                                                                                                                              
                             fontbox/src/main/java/org/apache/fontbox/pfb/PfbParser.java:166-171                                                                                                                 
                             ```                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             166:            byte[] ar = new byte[size];                                                                                                                                         
                             167:            int got = in.read(ar);                                                                                                                                              
                             168:            if (got != size)                                                                                                                                                    
                             169:            {                                                                                                                                                                   
                             170:                throw new EOFException("EOF while reading PFB font");                                                                                                           
                             171:            }                                                                                                                                                                   
                             ```                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             </code>                                                                                                                                                                             
                             </code_snippets>                                                                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             ## Fix Strategy                                                                                                                                                                     
                             <fix_strategy>                                                                                                                                                                      
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             1. Restore Missing I/O Imports                                                                                                                                                      
                                - Open `fontbox/src/main/java/org/apache/fontbox/pfb/PfbParser.java`.                                                                                                            
                                - In the import section at the top of the file, re-add the following two imports (they were inadvertently removed in the last patch):                                            
                                   `import java.io.ByteArrayInputStream;`                                                                                                                                       
                                   `import java.io.EOFException;`                                                                                                                                               
                                - Also tidy up any duplicate imports (e.g., remove the extra `import java.nio.file.Paths;`).                                                                                     
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             2. Verify Supporting Imports                                                                                                                                                        
                                - Ensure the existing imports for `java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream`, `java.io.IOException`, `java.io.InputStream`, `java.nio.file.Files`, `java.nio.file.Path`,                    
                             and `java.nio.file.Paths` remain present.                                                                                                                                           
                                - Your final import block should look roughly like:                                                                                                                              
                                  ```                                                                                                                                                                            
                                  import java.io.ByteArrayInputStream;                                                                                                                                           
                                  import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;                                                                                                                                          
                                  import java.io.EOFException;                                                                                                                                                   
                                  import java.io.IOException;                                                                                                                                                    
                                  import java.io.InputStream;                                                                                                                                                    
                                  import java.nio.file.Files;                                                                                                                                                    
                                  import java.nio.file.Path;                                                                                                                                                     
                                  import java.nio.file.Paths;                                                                                                                                                    
                                  import java.util.ArrayList;                                                                                                                                                    
                                  import java.util.Arrays;                                                                                                                                                       
                                  import java.util.List;                                                                                                                                                         
                                  ```                                                                                                                                                                            
                             3. Preserve Size-Limit Logic                                                                                                                                                        
                                - Do **not** alter the new `readAllBytesWithLimit` helper or the boundary checks in the constructors.                                                                            
                                - These helpers guard against unbounded memory usage on large or malformed PFB files and are critical to preventing the original `OutOfMemoryError`.                             
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             4. Rebuild & Test                                                                                                                                                                   
                                - Run `mvn clean compile` to confirm that all compilation errors related to `ByteArrayInputStream` and `EOFException` are resolved.                                              
                                - Execute the existing unit tests (and any fuzz harness runs) to ensure no regressions have been introduced.                                                                     
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             Justification                                                                                                                                                                       
                             - Re-adding the two missing imports directly addresses the four compilation failures reported (`cannot find symbol: ByteArrayInputStream` and `EOFException`).                      
                             - No business logic or public API has been modifiedonly the import declarationsso existing functionality and test coverage remain intact.                                         
                             - This fix keeps the fuzz harness unchanged, continues to enforce the intended size limits, and restores full compile-time type safety without compromising                         
                             memory-exhaustion safeguards.                                                                                                                                                       
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             </fix_strategy>

                             +    {                                                                                                                                                                              
                             +        long total = 0;                                                                                                                                                            
                             +        int marker = in.readUnsignedByte();                                                                                                                                        
                             +        if (marker != PFB_HEADER_MAGIC)                                                                                                                                            
                             +        {                                                                                                                                                                          
                             +            throw new IOException("Missing PFB marker");

                             +            int size = in.readUnsignedByte();                                                                                                                                      
                             +            size |= in.readUnsignedByte() << 8;                                                                                                                                    
                             +            size |= in.readUnsignedByte() << 16;                                                                                                                                   
                             +            size |= in.readUnsignedByte() << 24;                                                                                                                                   
                             +            total += size;                                                                                                                                                         
                             +            if (total > MAX_LENGTH)                                                                                                                                                
                             +            {                                                                                                                                                                      
                             +                throw new IOException("record size would be too large: " + total);                                                                                                 
                             +            }                                                                                                                                                                      
                             +            if (size < 0 || size > MAX_SEGMENT_LENGTH)                                                                                                                             
                             +            {                                                                                                                                                                      
                             +                throw new IOException("Invalid segment size: " + size);

                             +            byte[] data = new byte[size];

                             +                segment1 = data;

                             +                segment2 = data;

                             == libFuzzer crashing input ==                                                                                                                                                      
                             ===Evaluation Report===                                                                                                                                                             
                             # Evaluation Report                                                                                                                                                                 
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             ## Summary                                                                                                                                                                          
                             The initial issue is an OutOfMemoryError triggered during PDF text extraction with Jazzer, originating in the PfbParser.parsePfb method of Apache FontBox when                      
                             handling PFB (Printer Font Binary) data. A patch attempt was made by modifying `PfbParser.java`primarily adding imports (`ByteArrayOutputStream`, `Path`, `Paths`,                 
                             `ArrayList`, `List`) and presumably restructuring how PFB data is readyet after applying the patch, the same OutOfMemoryError recurred in the same parsing routine                 
                             (now at an updated line number).                                                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             ## Description                                                                                                                                                                      
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             Initial Issue                                                                                                                                                                       
                             - During fuzz testing (`com.example.PDFExtractTextFuzzer.fuzzerTestOneInput`), the fuzzer-driven PDF text extraction path invokes `PDFTextStripper.getText`, which                  
                             in turn calls into FontBoxs PFB parser.                                                                                                                                            
                             - The exception thrown is `java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space`, flagged by Jazzer as a `FuzzerSecurityIssueLow`.                                                           
                             - The stack trace pinpoints the failure at `PfbParser.parsePfb(PfbParser.java:166)` (init version) and propagating through `Type1Font.createWithPFB`,                               
                             `PDFontFactory.createFont`, and into the PDF stream engine and text stripper layers.                                                                                                
                             - No additional context on input size or parser internals is provided beyond the stack trace.                                                                                       
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             Important Observations                                                                                                                                                              
                             - The parser is consuming excessive heap memory when processing certain PFB segments.                                                                                               
                             - The error consistently arises in the same code path, indicating that the root cause remains in the PFB parsing logic.                                                             
                             - Line numbers shift after the patch, but the crash remains in `parsePfb`.                                                                                                          
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             Patch Attempt                                                                                                                                                                       
                             - In `fontbox/src/main/java/org/apache/fontbox/pfb/PfbParser.java`, new imports were introduced:                                                                                    
                                java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream                                                                                                                                                   
                                java.nio.file.Path, java.nio.file.Paths                                                                                                                                         
                                java.util.ArrayList, java.util.List                                                                                                                                             
                             - Redundant duplicate imports of `ArrayList` and `List` appear, suggesting an edit to facilitate buffered or temporary storage of PFB segments.                                     
                             - No modifications to method logic are shown in the patch excerptonly import additions and minor reordering.                                                                       
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             Result After Patch                                                                                                                                                                  
                             - The same `OutOfMemoryError` is thrown, now at `PfbParser.parsePfb(PfbParser.java:170)` and constructor at line 120, indicating that the source of excessive                       
                             memory use was not addressed.                                                                                                                                                       
                             - The downstream stack frames and DEDUP_TOKEN differ, but the failure mode is identical.                                                                                            
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             Areas for Further Investigation                                                                                                                                                     
                             - The implementation of `PfbParser.parsePfb`: how it reads and buffers PFB segments, and whether it enforces size limits.                                                           
                             - Allocation patterns in PFB segment handlingespecially usage of in-memory buffers (e.g., `ByteArrayOutputStream`, direct byte arrays).                                            
                             - Interaction between `PfbParser`, `Type1Font.createWithPFB`, and `PDFontFactory.createFont`: whether intermediate data structures balloon unexpectedly.                            
                             - Any configuration or limits in the fuzzer harness or heap settings (`-Xmx`) that might impact memory availability but do not constitute the core parsing logic                    
                             issue.                                                                                                                                                                              
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             ## Initial Issue Log

                             ===Analysis Report===                                                                                                                                                               
                             # Analysis Report                                                                                                                                                                   
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             ## Relevant Code Snippets
