                             </code>                                                                                                                                                                             
                             <code>                                                                                                                                                                              
                             fontbox/src/main/java/org/apache/fontbox/pfb/PfbParser.java:68-76                                                                                                                   
                             ```                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             68:    /**                                                                                                                                                                          
                             69:     * Heuristically chosen max length to buffer a Type1 font                                                                                                                    
                             70:     */                                                                                                                                                                          
                             71:    private static final long MAX_LENGTH = 100_000_000;                                                                                                                          
                             72:                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             73:    /**                                                                                                                                                                          
                             74:     * the parsed pfb-data.                                                                                                                                                      
                             75:     */                                                                                                                                                                          
                             76:    private byte[] pfbdata;                                                                                                                                                      
                             ```                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             </code>                                                                                                                                                                             
                             <code>                                                                                                                                                                              
                             fontbox/src/main/java/org/apache/fontbox/pfb/PfbParser.java:124-132                                                                                                                 
                             ```                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             124:    private void parsePfb(final byte[] pfb) throws IOException                                                                                                                  
                             125:    {                                                                                                                                                                           
                             126:        if (pfb.length < PFB_HEADER_LENGTH)                                                                                                                                     
                             127:        {                                                                                                                                                                       
                             128:            throw new IOException("PFB header missing");                                                                                                                        
                             129:        }                                                                                                                                                                       
                             130:        // read into segments and keep them                                                                                                                                     
                             131:        List<Integer> typeList = new ArrayList<>(3);                                                                                                                            
                             132:        List<byte[]> barrList = new ArrayList<>(3);                                                                                                                             
                             ```                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             </code>                                                                                                                                                                             
                             <code>                                                                                                                                                                              
                             fontbox/src/main/java/org/apache/fontbox/pfb/PfbParser.java:156-164                                                                                                                 
                             ```                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             156:            int size = in.read();                                                                                                                                               
                             157:            size += in.read() << 8;                                                                                                                                             
                             158:            size += in.read() << 16;                                                                                                                                            
                             159:            size += in.read() << 24;                                                                                                                                            
                             160:            LOG.debug("record type: {}, segment size: {}", recordType, size);                                                                                                   
                             161:            long newTotal = total + size;                                                                                                                                       
                             162:            if (newTotal > MAX_LENGTH) {                                                                                                                                        
                             163:                throw new IOException("record size would be too large: " + newTotal);                                                                                           
                             164:            }                                                                                                                                                                   
                             ```                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             </code>

                             168:            if (got != size)                                                                                                                                                    
                             169:            {

                             113:     */                                                                                                                                                                         
                             114:    public PfbParser(final byte[] bytes) throws IOException                                                                                                                     
                             115:    {

                             117:    }                                                                                                                                                                           
                             ```

                             <code>                                                                                                                                                                              
                             fontbox/src/main/java/org/apache/fontbox/type1/Type1Font.java:67-72                                                                                                                 
                             ```                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             67:    public static Type1Font createWithPFB(byte[] pfbBytes) throws IOException                                                                                                    
                             68:    {                                                                                                                                                                            
                             69:        PfbParser pfb = new PfbParser(pfbBytes);                                                                                                                                 
                             70:        Type1Parser parser = new Type1Parser();                                                                                                                                  
                             71:        return parser.parse(pfb.getSegment1(), pfb.getSegment2());                                                                                                               
                             72:    }                                                                                                                                                                            
                             ```                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             </code>                                                                                                                                                                             
                             </code_snippets>                                                                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             ## Fix Strategy                                                                                                                                                                     
                             <fix_strategy>                                                                                                                                                                      
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             1. Root Cause Analysis                                                                                                                                                              
                                - The current PfbParser constructors unconditionally call `in.readAllBytes()` (or `Files.readAllBytes`), loading the entire PFB stream into memory at once. For                  
                             large or maliciously crafted PFB data, this can exhaust the JVM heap before any parsing or size checks occur.                                                                       
                                - Even after splitting the data into segments, each segment is still allocated in full as a `byte[]`. Although `MAX_LENGTH` prevents the total of segment sizes                  
                             exceeding 100 MB, segments approaching that threshold still OOM on constrained heaps.                                                                                               
                                - The last patch only added imports (e.g., ByteArrayOutputStream, Path, List) but did not change the core logic of loading/ buffering.                                           
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             2. Strategy Outline                                                                                                                                                                 
                                A. Replace eager, unbounded full-file reads with a streaming, segment-by-segment parser.                                                                                         
                                   1. Remove `readAllBytes()`/`Files.readAllBytes()` calls.                                                                                                                      
                                   2. In the `InputStream` constructor:                                                                                                                                          
                                      - Wrap the input in a buffered `DataInputStream`.                                                                                                                          
                                      - Invoke a new private method `parsePfbStream(DataInputStream in)` that:                                                                                                   
                                         Reads and validates the PFB signature and header.                                                                                                                      
                                         Repeatedly reads segment markers (1-byte) and 4-byte little-endian lengths.                                                                                            
                                         Enforces the same `MAX_LENGTH` cumulative cap.                                                                                                                         
                                         For each segment:                                                                                                                                                      
                                           If segment size > a reasonable per-segment cap (e.g., `MAX_LENGTH`), abort early.                                                                                    
                                           Read the segment directly into a temporary buffer, then process or store only the minimal required data (e.g., ASCII commands or binary font                         
                             outlines) rather than keeping all raw bytes.                                                                                                                                        
                                   3. Drop the `byte[] pfbdata` field, as it is no longer needed: parsing becomes streaming, and only the two primary segments (ASCII 1 & 2) are stored for                      
                             later font decoding.                                                                                                                                                                
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                                B. Optimize Segment Storage                                                                                                                                                      
                                   - Currently two segments (`getSegment1()`, `getSegment2()`) are forwarded to the Type1 parser. Instead of storing all three raw segments in memory:                           
                                       Discard segment type 3 (if unused by downstream).                                                                                                                        
                                       For segment 1 and 2:                                                                                                                                                     
                                         If they contain text (ASCII commands), accumulate into a `ByteArrayOutputStream` or `StringBuilder` with per-line flushes.                                             
                                         If size is unexpectedly large, truncate after a configurable max (e.g., 10 MB), since Type 1 fonts rarely require huge segments.                                       
                                   - This limits worst-case memory use to near the highest legitimate PFB chunk, not the entire file.                                                                            
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                                C. Maintain Backward Compatibility                                                                                                                                               
                                   - Preserve existing APIs `PfbParser(InputStream)` and `PfbParser(byte[])` by redirecting them to the new streaming logic.                                                     
                                   - Preserve `getSegment1()`, `getSegment2()` signatures so that `Type1Font.createWithPFB` is unaffected.                                                                       
                                   - Reapply `MAX_LENGTH` enforcement at the segment level to avoid silently accepting large data.                                                                               
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             3. Detailed Steps                                                                                                                                                                   
                                1. In `PfbParser.java`:                                                                                                                                                          
                                   a. Remove `private byte[] pfbdata;`.                                                                                                                                          
                                   b. Refactor constructors:                                                                                                                                                     
                                      - `public PfbParser(InputStream in)`: replace `in.readAllBytes()` + `parsePfb` with:                                                                                       
                                        DataInputStream dis = new DataInputStream(new BufferedInputStream(in));                                                                                                  
                                        parsePfbStream(dis);                                                                                                                                                     
                                      - `public PfbParser(byte[] bytes)`: wrap bytes in a `ByteArrayInputStream` and delegate to the above constructor.                                                          
                                   c. Implement `private void parsePfbStream(DataInputStream in)`:                                                                                                               
                                      - Loop:                                                                                                                                                                    
                                         Read magic byte: `int marker = in.readUnsignedByte();`                                                                                                                 
                                         Read record type: `int recordType = in.readUnsignedByte();`                                                                                                            
                                         Read length as little-endian 4-byte int.                                                                                                                               
                                         Enforce `total += length; if (total > MAX_LENGTH) throw IOException`.                                                                                                  
                                         For supported record types (1 and 2), read exact `length` bytes into `ByteArrayOutputStream` or `ByteBuffer`.                                                          
                                         Skip or discard unsupported record types quickly: call `in.skipBytes(length)`.                                                                                         
                                         Stop loop when recordType == 3.                                                                                                                                        
                                      - Assign the two collected buffers to segment1 and segment2 fields.                                                                                                        
                                   d. Adjust or remove `parsePfb(byte[] pfb)` method and its usages.                                                                                                             
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                                2. In segment getters (`getSegment1()`, `getSegment2()`):                                                                                                                        
                                   - Return a trimmed copy or an immutable `byte[]` of the buffered data.                                                                                                        
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                                3. Add per-segment size limits:                                                                                                                                                  
                                   - Introduce `private static final int MAX_SEGMENT_LENGTH = 10_000_000;` and enforce it when reading each segment; throw an `IOException` for overly large                     
                             segments.                                                                                                                                                                           
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             4. Justification and Side-Effect Mitigation                                                                                                                                         
                                - Streaming parsing prevents any unbounded initial allocation (`readAllBytes()`), tackling the direct cause of OOM.                                                              
                                - Enforcing both cumulative (`MAX_LENGTH`) and per-segment (`MAX_SEGMENT_LENGTH`) size caps limits memory use to within expected PFB font sizes, while                           
                             preserving legitimate font parsing.                                                                                                                                                 
                                - By preserving APIs and only refactoring internals, no existing tests or harness code need to change.                                                                           
                                - Potential side effect: very large but legal PFB files near the limits will now fail fast with an `IOException`, which propagates as a parsing failure; known                   
                             valid fonts remain unaffected if under the caps.                                                                                                                                    
                                - This approach mirrors other streaming-based parsers in FontBox (e.g., `CFFParser`), ensuring consistency across font formats.                                                  
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             5. No external or harness modifications are required. All changes are internal to `PfbParser.java`.                                                                                 
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             </fix_strategy>                                                                                                                                                                     
                             ===Evaluation End===

                             +                throw new IOException("Invalid PFB marker: " + marker);

                             +            int recordType = in.readUnsignedByte();

                             +                break;                                                                                                                                                             
                             +            }                                                                                                                                                                      
                             +            if (recordType != ASCII_MARKER && recordType != BINARY_MARKER)

                             +                throw new IOException("Incorrect record type: " + recordType);

                             +            int size = in.readUnsignedByte();

                             +            size |= in.readUnsignedByte() << 16;                                                                                                                                   
                             +            size |= in.readUnsignedByte() << 24;                                                                                                                                   
                             +            if (size < 0 || size > MAX_SEGMENT_LENGTH)                                                                                                                             
                             +            {                                                                                                                                                                      
                             +                throw new IOException("Invalid segment size: " + size);                                                                                                            
                             +            }                                                                                                                                                                      
                             +            total += size;                                                                                                                                                         
                             +            if (total > MAX_LENGTH)                                                                                                                                                
                             +            {                                                                                                                                                                      
                             +                throw new IOException("Total PFB size would be too large: " + total);                                                                                              
                             +            }

                                     at com.example.PDFExtractTextFuzzer.fuzzerTestOneInput(PDFExtractTextFuzzer.java:41)                                                                                        
                                     at java.base/java.lang.invoke.LambdaForm$DMH/0x0000000800cbc000.invokeStaticInit(LambdaForm$DMH)                                                                            
                                     at java.base/java.lang.invoke.LambdaForm$MH/0x0000000800cbd000.invoke(LambdaForm$MH)                                                                                        
                                     at java.base/java.lang.invoke.LambdaForm$MH/0x0000000800cbc800.invoke_MT(LambdaForm$MH)                                                                                     
                             DEDUP_TOKEN: 4fc18e0e0662428e                                                                                                                                                       
                             == libFuzzer crashing input ==                                                                                                                                                      
                             ===Evaluation Report===                                                                                                                                                             
                             # Evaluation Report                                                                                                                                                                 
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             ## Summary                                                                                                                                                                          
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             The projects PDF processing component (`fontbox`) is triggering a Jazzer fuzzer security issue: an OutOfMemoryError when parsing large or malicious PFB (Printer                   
                             Font Binary) files.  The stack trace shows `PfbParser.parsePfb` loading the entire stream with `in.readAllBytes()`, causing excessive heap use.                                     
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             A patch was proposed to replace the byte-array buffering with a streaming parser (`parsePfbStream`), enforce per-segment size limits (`MAX_SEGMENT_LENGTH`), and                    
                             split the font into two segments (`segment1`, `segment2`).  After applying the patch, the build fails in `PfbParser.java` with dozens of syntax errors                              
                             (`<identifier> expected`, `class, interface, or enum expected`), indicating that the modifications introduced malformed or misplaced code.                                          
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             ## Description                                                                                                                                                                      
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             Initial Issue                                                                                                                                                                       
                             - A Jazzer fuzzing run on the `PDFExtractTextFuzzer` causes:                                                                                                                        
                               - `com.code_intelligence.jazzer.api.FuzzerSecurityIssueLow: Out of memory (use '-Xmx1710m' to reproduce)`                                                                         
                               - Root cause: `java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space` in `org.apache.fontbox.pfb.PfbParser.parsePfb`.                                                                       
                             - The existing `PfbParser` implementation reads the entire input into a single byte array (`in.readAllBytes()`), then splits it into segments.  Very large or                       
                             crafted inputs exhaust the Java heap.                                                                                                                                               
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             Key observations in the initial log                                                                                                                                                 
                             - The crash happens during font parsing when calling `Type1Font.createWithPFB`, downstream from `PfbParser.parsePfb`.                                                               
                             - The parser reads three records (ASCII/BINARY/ASCII) blindly, without streaming or per-segment caps.                                                                               
                             - There is an existing `MAX_LENGTH` guard against overly large total fonts, but it is applied only after loading into memory.                                                       
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             Patch Attempt                                                                                                                                                                       
                             - Added imports for `BufferedInputStream` and `DataInputStream`; removed `Files`, `Paths`, and various `java.util` lists.                                                           
                             - Introduced two byte-array fields (`segment1`, `segment2`) instead of a single `pfbdata`.                                                                                          
                             - Defined a new constant `MAX_SEGMENT_LENGTH = 10_000_000` to bound each segment.                                                                                                   
                             - Replaced the constructor that read all bytes with one that wraps the input in `DataInputStream` and calls `parsePfbStream`.                                                       
                             - Moved parsing logic from `parsePfb(byte[])` into `parsePfbStream(DataInputStream)`, reading markers and lengths one record at a time, checking `MAX_LENGTH` and                   
                             `MAX_SEGMENT_LENGTH`, and assigning data to `segment1` or `segment2`.                                                                                                               
                             - Kept a terminating marker check to exit the loop and added simple getters for the two segments.                                                                                   
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             Patch Result                                                                                                                                                                        
                             - Maven compilation fails in `PfbParser.java` with about 41 errors, all of the form:                                                                                                
                               - \<identifier> expected at field or method declarations.                                                                                                                       
                               - class, interface, or enum expected at lines where methods or fields appear.                                                                                                   
                             - The errors cluster around the new code (lines ~185290), suggesting:                                                                                                              
                               - Missing or mismatched braces `{}` around methods or the class body.                                                                                                             
                               - Possibly an unclosed method or class before the new segment of code.                                                                                                            
                               - Incorrect placement of import or package statements.                                                                                                                            
                               - References to types (`ByteArrayInputStream`, `MAX_LENGTH`) that may not be in scope due to removed imports.                                                                     
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             Areas for Further Investigation                                                                                                                                                     
                             - The full `PfbParser.java` after patch to verify proper bracing and nesting of methods and classes.                                                                                
                             - Import statements: ensure `java.io.ByteArrayInputStream` is imported or fully qualified where used.                                                                               
                             - Consistency of constant definitions (`MAX_LENGTH`, `MAX_SEGMENT_LENGTH`) and their visibility to all methods.                                                                     
                             - The classs closing brace locationlook for unmatched `{` or `}` around both old and new code.                                                                                    
                             - Any residual references (`List`, `typeList`, `barrList`, `ar`) left behind that may conflict with the new fields.                                                                 
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             This code region in `PfbParser.java`from the start of the `parsePfbStream` method through the new gettersshould be examined to restore syntactic correctness                      
                             before re-running the build.                                                                                                                                                        
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             ## Initial Issue Log
