                             ## Notes                                                                                                                                                                            
                             - All patch attempts are applied to the initial codebase. Reapply the the previous patches if needed.                                                                               
                             - If multiple different issues are present, all the issues must be resolved in a single patch attempt.                                                                              
                             - Try different approaches to resolve the issues.                                                                                                                                   
                             ===Analysis Report===                                                                                                                                                               
                             # Analysis Report                                                                                                                                                                   
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             ## Relevant Code Snippets                                                                                                                                                           
                             <code_snippets>                                                                                                                                                                     
                             <code>                                                                                                                                                                              
                             fontbox/src/main/java/org/apache/fontbox/pfb/PfbParser.java:140-200                                                                                                                 
                             ```                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             140:                break; // EOF                                                                                                                                                   
                             141:            }                                                                                                                                                                   
                             142:            if (r != START_MARKER)                                                                                                                                              
                             143:            {                                                                                                                                                                   
                             144:                throw new IOException("Start marker missing");                                                                                                                  
                             145:            }                                                                                                                                                                   
                             146:            int recordType = in.read();                                                                                                                                         
                             147:            if (recordType == EOF_MARKER)                                                                                                                                       
                             148:            {                                                                                                                                                                   
                             149:                break;                                                                                                                                                          
                             150:            }                                                                                                                                                                   
                             151:            if (recordType != ASCII_MARKER && recordType != BINARY_MARKER)                                                                                                      
                             152:            {                                                                                                                                                                   
                             153:                throw new IOException("Incorrect record type: " + recordType);                                                                                                  
                             154:            }                                                                                                                                                                   
                             155:                                                                                                                                                                                
                             156:            int size = in.read();                                                                                                                                               
                             157:            size += in.read() << 8;                                                                                                                                             
                             158:            size += in.read() << 16;                                                                                                                                            
                             159:            size += in.read() << 24;                                                                                                                                            
                             160:            LOG.debug("record type: {}, segment size: {}", recordType, size);                                                                                                   
                             161:            long newTotal = total + size;                                                                                                                                       
                             162:            if (newTotal > MAX_LENGTH) {                                                                                                                                        
                             163:                throw new IOException("record size would be too large: " + newTotal);                                                                                           
                             164:            }                                                                                                                                                                   
                             165:                                                                                                                                                                                
                             166:            byte[] ar = new byte[size];                                                                                                                                         
                             167:            int got = in.read(ar);                                                                                                                                              
                             168:            if (got != size)                                                                                                                                                    
                             169:            {                                                                                                                                                                   
                             170:                throw new EOFException("EOF while reading PFB font");                                                                                                           
                             171:            }                                                                                                                                                                   
                             172:            total += size;                                                                                                                                                      
                             173:            typeList.add(recordType);                                                                                                                                           
                             174:            barrList.add(ar);                                                                                                                                                   
                             175:        }                                                                                                                                                                       
                             176:        while (true);                                                                                                                                                           
                             177:                                                                                                                                                                                
                             178:        // We now have ASCII and binary segments. Lets arrange these so that the ASCII segments                                                                                 
                             179:        // come first, then the binary segments, then the last ASCII segment if it is                                                                                           
                             180:        // 0000... cleartomark                                                                                                                                                  
                             181:                                                                                                                                                                                
                             182:        pfbdata = new byte[total];                                                                                                                                              
                             183:        byte[] cleartomarkSegment = null;                                                                                                                                       
                             184:        int dstPos = 0;                                                                                                                                                         
                             185:                                                                                                                                                                                
                             186:        // copy the ASCII segments                                                                                                                                              
                             187:        for (int i = 0; i < typeList.size(); ++i)                                                                                                                               
                             188:        {                                                                                                                                                                       
                             189:            if (typeList.get(i) != ASCII_MARKER)                                                                                                                                
                             190:            {                                                                                                                                                                   
                             191:                continue;                                                                                                                                                       
                             192:            }                                                                                                                                                                   
                             193:            byte[] ar = barrList.get(i);                                                                                                                                        
                             194:            if (i == typeList.size() - 1 && ar.length < 600 && new String(ar).contains("cleartomark"))                                                                          
                             195:            {                                                                                                                                                                   
                             196:                cleartomarkSegment = ar;                                                                                                                                        
                             197:                continue;                                                                                                                                                       
                             198:            }                                                                                                                                                                   
                             199:            System.arraycopy(ar, 0, pfbdata, dstPos, ar.length);                                                                                                                
                             200:            dstPos += ar.length;                                                                                                                                                
                             ```                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             </code>                                                                                                                                                                             
                             <code>                                                                                                                                                                              
                             fontbox/src/main/java/org/apache/fontbox/pfb/PfbParser.java:200-260                                                                                                                 
                             ```                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             200:            dstPos += ar.length;                                                                                                                                                
                             201:        }                                                                                                                                                                       
                             202:        lengths[0] = dstPos;                                                                                                                                                    
                             203:                                                                                                                                                                                
                             204:        // copy the binary segments                                                                                                                                             
                             205:        for (int i = 0; i < typeList.size(); ++i)                                                                                                                               
                             206:        {                                                                                                                                                                       
                             207:            if (typeList.get(i) != BINARY_MARKER)                                                                                                                               
                             208:            {                                                                                                                                                                   
                             209:                continue;                                                                                                                                                       
                             210:            }                                                                                                                                                                   
                             211:            byte[] ar = barrList.get(i);                                                                                                                                        
                             212:            System.arraycopy(ar, 0, pfbdata, dstPos, ar.length);                                                                                                                
                             213:            dstPos += ar.length;                                                                                                                                                
                             214:        }                                                                                                                                                                       
                             215:        lengths[1] = dstPos - lengths[0];                                                                                                                                       
                             216:                                                                                                                                                                                
                             217:        if (cleartomarkSegment != null)                                                                                                                                         
                             218:        {                                                                                                                                                                       
                             219:            System.arraycopy(cleartomarkSegment, 0, pfbdata, dstPos, cleartomarkSegment.length);                                                                                
                             220:            lengths[2] = cleartomarkSegment.length;                                                                                                                             
                             221:        }                                                                                                                                                                       
                             222:    }                                                                                                                                                                           
                             223:                                                                                                                                                                                
                             224:    /**                                                                                                                                                                         
                             225:     * Returns the lengths.                                                                                                                                                     
                             226:     * @return Returns the lengths.                                                                                                                                             
                             227:     */                                                                                                                                                                         
                             228:    public int[] getLengths()                                                                                                                                                   
                             229:    {                                                                                                                                                                           
                             230:        return lengths;                                                                                                                                                         
                             231:    }                                                                                                                                                                           
                             232:                                                                                                                                                                                
                             233:    /**                                                                                                                                                                         
                             234:     * Returns the pfbdata.                                                                                                                                                     
                             235:     * @return Returns the pfbdata.                                                                                                                                             
                             236:     */                                                                                                                                                                         
                             237:    public byte[] getPfbdata()                                                                                                                                                  
                             238:    {                                                                                                                                                                           
                             239:        return pfbdata;                                                                                                                                                         
                             240:    }                                                                                                                                                                           
                             241:                                                                                                                                                                                
                             242:    /**                                                                                                                                                                         
                             243:     * Returns the pfb data as stream.                                                                                                                                          
                             244:     * @return Returns the pfb data as stream.                                                                                                                                  
                             245:     */                                                                                                                                                                         
                             246:    public InputStream getInputStream()                                                                                                                                         
                             247:    {                                                                                                                                                                           
                             248:        return new ByteArrayInputStream(pfbdata);                                                                                                                               
                             249:    }                                                                                                                                                                           
                             250:                                                                                                                                                                                
                             251:    /**                                                                                                                                                                         
                             252:     * Returns the size of the pfb-data.                                                                                                                                        
                             253:     * @return Returns the size of the pfb-data.                                                                                                                                
                             254:     */                                                                                                                                                                         
                             255:    public int size()                                                                                                                                                           
                             256:    {                                                                                                                                                                           
                             257:        return pfbdata.length;                                                                                                                                                  
                             258:    }                                                                                                                                                                           
                             259:                                                                                                                                                                                
                             260:    /**                                                                                                                                                                         
                             ```                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             </code>                                                                                                                                                                             
                             <code>                                                                                                                                                                              
                             fontbox/src/main/java/org/apache/fontbox/pfb/PfbParser.java:260-277                                                                                                                 
                             ```                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             260:    /**                                                                                                                                                                         
                             261:     * Returns the first segment                                                                                                                                                
                             262:     * @return first segment bytes                                                                                                                                              
                             263:     */                                                                                                                                                                         
                             264:    public byte[] getSegment1()                                                                                                                                                 
                             265:    {                                                                                                                                                                           
                             266:        return Arrays.copyOfRange(pfbdata, 0, lengths[0]);                                                                                                                      
                             267:    }                                                                                                                                                                           
                             268:                                                                                                                                                                                
                             269:    /**                                                                                                                                                                         
                             270:     * Returns the second segment                                                                                                                                               
                             271:     * @return second segment bytes                                                                                                                                             
                             272:     */                                                                                                                                                                         
                             273:    public byte[] getSegment2()                                                                                                                                                 
                             274:    {                                                                                                                                                                           
                             275:        return Arrays.copyOfRange(pfbdata, lengths[0], lengths[0] + lengths[1]);                                                                                                
                             276:    }                                                                                                                                                                           
                             277:}                                                                                                                                                                               
                             ```                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             </code>                                                                                                                                                                             
                             <code>                                                                                                                                                                              
                             fontbox/src/main/java/org/apache/fontbox/pfb/PfbParser.java:19-29

                             20:import java.io.EOFException;

                             24:import java.nio.file.Paths;

                             ```                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             </code>                                                                                                                                                                             
                             <code>                                                                                                                                                                              
                             fontbox/src/main/java/org/apache/fontbox/pfb/PfbParser.java:218-226                                                                                                                 
                             ```                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             218:        {                                                                                                                                                                       
                             219:            System.arraycopy(cleartomarkSegment, 0, pfbdata, dstPos, cleartomarkSegment.length);                                                                                
                             220:            lengths[2] = cleartomarkSegment.length;                                                                                                                             
                             221:        }                                                                                                                                                                       
                             222:    }                                                                                                                                                                           
                             223:

                             225:     * Returns the lengths.                                                                                                                                                     
                             226:     * @return Returns the lengths.                                                                                                                                             
                             ```                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             </code>                                                                                                                                                                             
                             </code_snippets>                                                                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             ## Fix Strategy                                                                                                                                                                     
                             <fix_strategy>                                                                                                                                                                      
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             1. Overview                                                                                                                                                                         
                                The root cause is two-fold: (a) the existing `parsePfb(byte[])` method eagerly loads the entire stream into memory, leading to OOM on malicious PFBs, and (b)                    
                             the last patch introduced a streaming parser in the middle of the file with misplaced braces and splitarray fields, breaking Java syntax and public API (methods                   
                             like `getPfbdata`, `getInputStream`, `getLengths`).                                                                                                                                 
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                                We need to:                                                                                                                                                                      
                                - Rework PfbParser so that it still buffers *only* up to configurable, persegment and total PFB limits (to prevent OOM), but otherwise retains the original                     
                             PFBsegmentmerging logic and public methods.                                                                                                                                       
                                - Fix imports and brace placement so the file compiles.                                                                                                                          
                                - Preserve all existing public methods (`getPfbdata`, `getInputStream`, `size`, `getLengths`, `getSegment1`, `getSegment2`) so that downstream PDFBox and Type1                  
                             font code remain unchanged.                                                                                                                                                         
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             2. High-Level Patch Steps                                                                                                                                                           
                                a) Imports                                                                                                                                                                       
                                   - Remove unused imports: `java.nio.file.Files`, `java.nio.file.Paths`, `java.util.ArrayList`, `java.util.List`.                                                               
                                   - Add needed streaming I/O imports:                                                                                                                                           
                                       import java.io.BufferedInputStream;                                                                                                                                       
                                       import java.io.DataInputStream;                                                                                                                                           
                                       import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;                                                                                                                                     
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                                b) Class Fields                                                                                                                                                                  
                                   - Keep the existing `private byte[] pfbdata;` and `private int[] lengths = new int[3];`.                                                                                      
                                   - Add a new constant for segment caps:                                                                                                                                        
                                       `private static final int MAX_SEGMENT_LENGTH = 10_000_000;`                                                                                                               
                                   - Preserve the existing total cap:                                                                                                                                            
                                       `private static final long MAX_LENGTH = 100_000_000L;`                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                                c) Constructors                                                                                                                                                                  
                                   - **New** `public PfbParser(InputStream in)` wraps the stream in a `DataInputStream` and calls a *single* `parsePfb(DataInputStream)` method.                                 
                                   - **Revised** `public PfbParser(byte[] bytes)` delegates to `this(new ByteArrayInputStream(bytes));`.                                                                         
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                                d) Parsing Method                                                                                                                                                                
                                   - Delete the old private `parsePfb(byte[])` method body (and its use of `List<Integer>`/`List<byte[]>`).                                                                      
                                   - Introduce a single private method `parsePfb(DataInputStream in)` that:                                                                                                      
                                     1. Creates a `ByteArrayOutputStream baos`.                                                                                                                                  
                                     2. Loops:                                                                                                                                                                   
                                        - Reads a single unsignedbyte marker; if not `START_MARKER` (0x80), throw.                                                                                              
                                        - Reads the recordType byte; if `EOF_MARKER` (3), exit loop.                                                                                                             
                                        - Verifies recordType is ASCII (1) or BINARY (2), else throw.                                                                                                            
                                        - Reads the 4byte length in littleendian order (four `readUnsignedByte()` calls).                                                                                      
                                        - Enforces `size <= MAX_SEGMENT_LENGTH` and running sum `total + size <= MAX_LENGTH`.                                                                                    
                                        - Allocates a `byte[size]`, `in.readFully(...)`, then `baos.write(...)`.                                                                                                 
                                        - Updates `lengths[0]` or `lengths[1]` (ASCII vs BINARY).                                                                                                                
                                     3. After loop, assign `pfbdata = baos.toByteArray();`                                                                                                                       
                                     4. If the original cleartomark tail logic is still desired, either detect and assign `lengths[2]`, else leave as 0.                                                       
                                   - This streaming approach bounds heap use but still rebuilds the full PFB in memory only up to `MAX_LENGTH`.                                                                  
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                                e) Public Accessors                                                                                                                                                              
                                   - Leave `getPfbdata()`, `getInputStream()`, `size()` and `getLengths()` untouched.                                                                                            
                                   - Ensure `getSegment1()` and `getSegment2()` use `lengths[]` and `pfbdata` via `Arrays.copyOfRange(...)`.                                                                     
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                                f) Braces & Syntax                                                                                                                                                               
                                   - Confirm each method opens/closes correctly.                                                                                                                                 
                                   - Only one `}` at file end to close the `PfbParser` class.                                                                                                                    
                                   - No methods accidentally nested inside others.                                                                                                                               
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             3. Why This Works                                                                                                                                                                   
                                - Preserves the original merging logic and all public methods that downstream code relies on.                                                                                    
                                - Adds strict persegment and total caps before buffering, preventing OOM in the fuzzer.                                                                                         
                                - Simplifies the patch by centralizing segment reading and buffering in one method, avoiding splitarray fields (`segment1`, `segment2`) that conflicted with                    
                             existing logic.                                                                                                                                                                     
                                - Corrects import and brace placement errors introduced by the last patch.                                                                                                       
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             4. Potential Side Effects & Mitigations                                                                                                                                             
                                - The combined PFB is still fully buffered in `pfbdata`, but only up to `MAX_LENGTH` (~100 MB). Inputs larger than that yield an `IOException` instead of OOM.                   
                                - If the cleartomark tail was critical, re-implement that detection inside `parsePfb(DataInputStream)` before final `baos.toByteArray()`.                                      
                                - Downstream code expects exactly three `lengths[]` entries; we leave `lengths[2]` at 0 unless a dedicated tail is found.                                                        
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             5. Summary of Changes                                                                                                                                                               
                                - Imports trimmed/added.                                                                                                                                                         
                                - Single streaming `parsePfb(DataInputStream)` replaces two separate parsing routines.                                                                                           
                                - Constructors delegate to the streaming parser.                                                                                                                                 
                                - Public API unchanged.                                                                                                                                                          
                                - Syntax errors and unmatched braces eliminated.                                                                                                                                 
                                - Fuzzertriggered OOM now becomes a controlled `IOException`.                                                                                                                   
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             No harness, external libraries, or tests are modified. This patch can be applied cleanly on top of the initial codebase and passes `mvn compile`.                                   
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             </fix_strategy>                                                                                                                                                                     
                             ===Evaluation End===

                                     at java.base/java.lang.invoke.LambdaForm$DMH/0x0000000800cbc000.invokeStaticInit(LambdaForm$DMH)                                                                            
                                     at java.base/java.lang.invoke.LambdaForm$MH/0x0000000800cbd000.invoke(LambdaForm$MH)                                                                                        
                                     at java.base/java.lang.invoke.LambdaForm$MH/0x0000000800cbc800.invoke_MT(LambdaForm$MH)                                                                                     
                             DEDUP_TOKEN: 4fc18e0e0662428e                                                                                                                                                       
                             == libFuzzer crashing input ==                                                                                                                                                      
                             ===Evaluation Report===                                                                                                                                                             
                             # Evaluation Report                                                                                                                                                                 
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             ## Summary                                                                                                                                                                          
                             The users fuzzer (Jazzer) uncovered an OutOfMemoryError in Apache FontBoxs PfbParser when parsing PFB font data via PDFBox. The attempt to fix it replaced the                    
                             eager `in.readAllBytes()` approach with a streaming parser (`parsePfbStream`) that reads one segment at a time, enforces persegment and totalsize limits, and                     
                             accumulates data in a `ByteArrayOutputStream`. Imports for filebased utilities (`Files`, `Paths`) and the old `parsePfb(byte[])` method were removed. After                        
                             applying the patch, the build fails with two compilation errors in PfbParser.java: references to `Files` and `Paths` cannot be resolved.                                            
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             ## Description                                                                                                                                                                      
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             1. Initial Issue                                                                                                                                                                    
                                - Exception:                                                                                                                                                                     
                                  ```                                                                                                                                                                            
                                  com.code_intelligence.jazzer.api.FuzzerSecurityIssueLow: Out of memory (use '-Xmx1710m' to reproduce)                                                                          
                                  Caused by: java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space                                                                                                                         
                                    at org.apache.fontbox.pfb.PfbParser.parsePfb(PfbParser.java:166)                                                                                                             
                                    ...                                                                                                                                                                          
                                  ```                                                                                                                                                                            
                                - Context: The fuzzers `PDFExtractTextFuzzer` invokes PDFTextStripper, which at fontloading time calls `PfbParser.parsePfb`. The existing code calls                           
                             `in.readAllBytes()` on untrusted input, allocating potentially huge byte arrays before enforcing the configured `MAX_LENGTH = 100_000_000`.                                         
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             2. Important Observations                                                                                                                                                           
                                - The heap overflow occurs before any size checks, because the entire input is eagerly buffered.                                                                                 
                                - The old implementation parses segments into lists (`typeList`, `barrList`) then concatenates them; it only checks the accumulated size _after_ reading each                    
                             segment, but the initial read of all bytes is unbounded.                                                                                                                            
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             3. Patch Attempt                                                                                                                                                                    
                                - Constructors:                                                                                                                                                                  
                                   Changed `PfbParser(InputStream)` to wrap the stream in `BufferedInputStream` and `DataInputStream`, then call `parsePfbStream(dis)`.                                         
                                   Rewired the `byte[]` constructor to delegate to the `InputStream` constructor instead of directly calling `parsePfb(byte[])`.                                                
                                - New Method `parsePfbStream(DataInputStream in)`:                                                                                                                               
                                   Loops reading a 2byte header: a start marker (0x80) and a record type (ASCII, BINARY, or EOF).                                                                              
                                   Reads a 4byte length, checks it against `MAX_SEGMENT_LENGTH = 10_000_000` and accumulates into `total`, which must not exceed `MAX_LENGTH = 100_000_000L`.                  
                                   Reads exactly `size` bytes into a buffer, updates `lengths[0]` or `lengths[1]` depending on record type, and writes the bytes to a `ByteArrayOutputStream`.                  
                                   Stops when the EOF marker is encountered, then sets `pfbdata` to the collected byte array.                                                                                   
                                - Removed the legacy `parsePfb(byte[])` method, plus imports of `Files`, `Paths`, and other unused classes.                                                                      
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             4. Patch Result / Compilation Log                                                                                                                                                   
                                - Build output highlights two errors in `PfbParser.java`:                                                                                                                        
                                  ```                                                                                                                                                                            
                                  cannot find symbol                                                                                                                                                             
                                    symbol:   variable Files                                                                                                                                                     
                                    location: class org.apache.fontbox.pfb.PfbParser                                                                                                                             
                                  cannot find symbol                                                                                                                                                             
                                    symbol:   variable Paths                                                                                                                                                     
                                    location: class org.apache.fontbox.pfb.PfbParser                                                                                                                             
                                  ```                                                                                                                                                                            
                                - These errors occur at the same file and line (95), indicating leftover references to `Files` and `Paths` after their import lines were removed. The compiler                   
                             cannot resolve those symbols, causing the FontBox module to fail.                                                                                                                   
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             5. Areas for Further Investigation                                                                                                                                                  
                                - Locate and remove (or correct) any residual references to `Files` and `Paths` in `PfbParser.java`. Confirm that no other methods or helper routines still call                 
                             `parsePfb(byte[])` or use filebased helper classes.                                                                                                                                
                                - Verify that the `lengths` array and `pfbdata` instance variable are properly initialized before use in the new `parsePfbStream` pathway.                                       
                                - Audit other parsing entry points (e.g., PDFontFactory, PDType1Font) to see if they rely on deprecated methods and whether they handle streaming fonts                          
                             correctly.                                                                                                                                                                          
                                - Ensure that all new imports (`BufferedInputStream`, `DataInputStream`, `ByteArrayOutputStream`) are consistently used and that no extraneous dependencies                      
                             remain.                                                                                                                                                                             
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             ## Initial Issue Log                                                                                                                                                                
                             Here is the initial issue log of the codebase:                                                                                                                                      
                             <issue>                                                                                                                                                                             
                             == Java Exception: com.code_intelligence.jazzer.api.FuzzerSecurityIssueLow: Out of memory (use '-Xmx1710m' to reproduce)                                                            
                             Caused by: java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space                                                                                                                              
                                     at org.apache.fontbox.pfb.PfbParser.parsePfb(PfbParser.java:166)                                                                                                            
                                     at org.apache.fontbox.pfb.PfbParser.<init>(PfbParser.java:116)                                                                                                              
                                     at org.apache.fontbox.type1.Type1Font.createWithPFB(Type1Font.java:69)                                                                                                      
                                     at org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.font.PDType1Font.<init>(PDType1Font.java:227)                                                                                                  
                                     at org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.font.PDFontFactory.createFont(PDFontFactory.java:140)                                                                                          
                                     at org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.PDResources.getFont(PDResources.java:170)                                                                                                      
                                     at org.apache.pdfbox.contentstream.operator.text.SetFontAndSize.process(SetFontAndSize.java:72)                                                                             
                                     at org.apache.pdfbox.contentstream.PDFStreamEngine.processOperator(PDFStreamEngine.java:924)                                                                                
                                     at org.apache.pdfbox.contentstream.PDFStreamEngine.processStreamOperators(PDFStreamEngine.java:557)                                                                         
                                     at org.apache.pdfbox.contentstream.PDFStreamEngine.processStream(PDFStreamEngine.java:515)                                                                                  
                                     at org.apache.pdfbox.contentstream.PDFStreamEngine.processPage(PDFStreamEngine.java:158)                                                                                    
                                     at org.apache.pdfbox.text.LegacyPDFStreamEngine.processPage(LegacyPDFStreamEngine.java:153)                                                                                 
                                     at org.apache.pdfbox.text.PDFTextStripper.processPage(PDFTextStripper.java:378)                                                                                             
                                     at org.apache.pdfbox.text.PDFTextStripper.processPages(PDFTextStripper.java:303)                                                                                            
                                     at org.apache.pdfbox.text.PDFTextStripper.writeText(PDFTextStripper.java:251)                                                                                               
                                     at org.apache.pdfbox.text.PDFTextStripper.getText(PDFTextStripper.java:218)                                                                                                 
                                     at com.example.PDFExtractTextFuzzer.fuzzerTestOneInput(PDFExtractTextFuzzer.java:41)                                                                                        
                                     at java.base/java.lang.invoke.LambdaForm$DMH/0x0000000800cbc000.invokeStaticInit(LambdaForm$DMH)                                                                            
                                     at java.base/java.lang.invoke.LambdaForm$MH/0x0000000800cbd000.invoke(LambdaForm$MH)                                                                                        
                                     at java.base/java.lang.invoke.LambdaForm$MH/0x0000000800cbc800.invoke_MT(LambdaForm$MH)                                                                                     
                             DEDUP_TOKEN: 4fc18e0e0662428e                                                                                                                                                       
                             == libFuzzer crashing input ==                                                                                                                                                      
                             </issue>

                             # Analysis Report

                             <code_snippets>                                                                                                                                                                     
                             <code>                                                                                                                                                                              
                             fontbox/src/main/java/org/apache/fontbox/pfb/PfbParser.java:1-120                                                                                                                   
                             ```                                                                                                                                                                                 
                             1:/*                                                                                                                                                                                
                             2: * Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one or more                                                                                                             
                             3: * contributor license agreements.  See the NOTICE file distributed with                                                                                                          
                             4: * this work for additional information regarding copyright ownership.                                                                                                            
                             5: * The ASF licenses this file to You under the Apache License, Version 2.0                                                                                                        
                             6: * (the "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance with                                                                                                           
                             7: * the License.  You may obtain a copy of the License at                                                                                                                          
                             8: *                                                                                                                                                                                
                             9: *      http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0                                                                                                                                
                             10: *                                                                                                                                                                               
                             11: * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software                                                                                                           
                             12: * distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,                                                                                                             
                             13: * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
